question: At equilibrium, the value of the reaction quotient is equal to the equilibrium constant, K[eq]. Generally for chemical reactions:

answers.A: The size of K[eq] does not demonstrate the relative amounts of reactants to products in the equilibrium mixture
answers.B: The same chemical reactions have different values of K[eq]
answers.C: Different chemical reactions have different values of K[eq]
answers.D: K[eq] is constant at any temperature for all reactions and for all equilibrium mixtures
